definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: By the end of1939, the whole of the north-eastern quarter of China was under Japanese occupation.
sentences.chinese: 到1939年底，中国整个东北地区都被日军占领。

sentences.english: During the Sino-Japanese War, the city wall of Nanjing was greatly damaged.

sentences.english: When Japan occupied Nanjing, they were relieved and went back home.

sentences.english: An estimated 1, 300 Japanese were killed by the Marines in this operation. (AP Photo)

definition: Japanese devil (common term of abuse in wartime China and in subsequent writing)
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
Pacific War between Japan and the US, 1941-1945
to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
